BitField.name: MPROT3
BitField.description: Master 3 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control.

Enum.name: MPL0
Enum.description: Accesses from this master are forced to user-mode (ips_supervisor_access is forced to zero) regardless of the hprot[1] access attribute.

Enum.name: MPL1
Enum.description: Accesses from this master are not forced to user-mode. The hprot[1] access attribute is used directly to determine ips_supervisor_access.

Enum.name: TP0
Enum.description: Accesses from an untrusted master are allowed.

Enum.name: TP1
Enum.description: Accesses from an untrusted master are not allowed. If an access is attempted by an untrusted master, the access is terminated with an error response and no peripheral access is initiated on the IPS bus.

BitField.name: MPROT3
BitField.description: Master 3 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control.

Enum.name: MPL0
Enum.description: Accesses from this master are forced to user-mode (ips_supervisor_access is forced to zero) regardless of the hprot[1] access attribute.

Enum.name: MPL1
Enum.description: Accesses from this master are not forced to user-mode. The hprot[1] access attribute is used directly to determine ips_supervisor_access.

Enum.name: powered_up
Enum.description: Zero cross detetion function powered up

Enum.name: powered_down
Enum.description: Zero cross detetion function powered down

Enum.name: xtal_clk
Enum.description: If DISABLE_AUTO_CLK_SWITCH is set to 0 and 24M xtal is OK, the clock source will switch from internal ring OSC to 24M xtal automatically

Enum.name: sel_clk
Enum.description: If DISABLE_AUTO_CLK_SWITCH is set to 1, SEL_CLK will determine which clock source the DCDC uses

BitField.name: PWD_CUR_SNS_CMP
BitField.description: Power down signal of the current detector.

Enum.name: select_zero
Enum.description: In Run Mode, 1 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.25 A

Enum.name: select_one
Enum.description: In Run Mode, 2 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.25 A

Enum.name: select_two
Enum.description: In Run Mode, 1 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.2 A

Enum.name: select_three
Enum.description: In Run Mode, 2 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.2 A

Enum.name: enabled
Enum.description: Low voltage detection comparator is enabled

Enum.name: disabled
Enum.description: Low voltage detection comparator is disabled

Enum.name: disabled
Enum.description: Overload Detection in power save mode disabled

Enum.name: enabled
Enum.description: Overload Detection in power save mode enabled

Enum.name: lp_12p5mV
Enum.description: Adjust hysteretic value in low power to 12.5mV

Enum.name: lp_25mV
Enum.description: Adjust hysteretic value in low power to 25mV

Enum.name: disabled
Enum.description: Disable xtalok detection circuit and always outputs OK signal "1"

BitField.name: REG_FBK_SEL
BitField.description: Select the feedback point of the internal regulator

Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel0
Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.0V with 1.2V reference voltage

Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel1
Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.1V with 1.2V reference voltage

Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel2
Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.0V with 1.3V reference voltage

Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel3
Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.1V with 1.3V reference voltage

BitField.name: REG_RLOAD_SW
BitField.description: This controls the load resistor of the internal regulator of DCDC

Enum.name: low_hyst_thresh
Enum.description: Lower hysteresis threshold (about 2.5mV in typical, but this value can vary with PVT corners

Enum.name: disable
Enum.description: Disable hysteresis in switching converter common mode analog comparators

Enum.name: enable
Enum.description: Enable hysteresis in switching converter common mode analog comparators

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_DC_FF
BitField.description: Two's complement feed forward step in duty cycle in the switching DC-DC converter

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_RCSCALE_THRSH
BitField.description: Increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.

Enum.name: no_increase_thrsh
Enum.description: Do not increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.

Enum.name: increase_thrsh
Enum.description: Increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_HYST_SIGN
BitField.description: Invert the sign of the hysteresis in DC-DC analog comparators.

Enum.name: noinvert
Enum.description: Do not invert sign of the hysteresis

Enum.name: idle
Enum.description: DCDC will be idle to save current dissipation when the duty cycle get to the low limit which is set by NEGLIMIT_IN.

Enum.name: not_idle
Enum.description: DCDC will keep working with the low limited duty cycle NEGLIMIT_IN.

BitField.name: MINPWR_DC_HALFCLK
BitField.description: Set DCDC clock to half frequency for continuous mode

Enum.name: fullfreq
Enum.description: DCDC clock remains at full frequency for continuous mode

Enum.name: halffreq
Enum.description: DCDC clock set to half frequency for continuous mode

Enum.name: enable
Enum.description: Enable stepping for the output of VDD_SOC of DCDC

Enum.name: disable
Enum.description: Disable stepping for the output of VDD_SOC of DCDC

Enum.name: t000001
Enum.description: Timers continue to run in Debug mode.

Enum.name: t0000011
Enum.description: Timers are stopped in Debug mode.

Enum.name: t0301
Enum.description: Clock for standard PIT timers is enabled.

Enum.name: t00000111
Enum.description: Clock for standard PIT timers is disabled.

Enum.name: t0331
Enum.description: Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.

Enum.name: t077711
Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.

Enum.name: timer0081
Enum.description: Timer is chained to a previous timer. For example, for channel 2, if this field is set, Timer 2 is chained to Timer 1.

Enum.name: t0331
Enum.description: Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.

Enum.name: t077711
Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.

Enum.name: timer0081
Enum.description: Timer is chained to a previous timer. For example, for channel 2, if this field is set, Timer 2 is chained to Timer 1.

Enum.name: t0331
Enum.description: Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.

Enum.name: t077711
Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.

Enum.name: timer0081
Enum.description: Timer is chained to a previous timer. For example, for channel 2, if this field is set, Timer 2 is chained to Timer 1.

Enum.name: t0331
Enum.description: Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.

Enum.name: t077711
Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.

Enum.name: timer0081
Enum.description: Timer is chained to a previous timer. For example, for channel 2, if this field is set, Timer 2 is chained to Timer 1.

Enum.name: LPSR_MODE_ENABLE_0
Enum.description: SNVS domain will reset when system reset happens

Enum.name: LPSR_MODE_ENABLE_1
Enum.description: SNVS domain will only reset with SNVS POR

Enum.name: POR_PULL_TYPE_0
Enum.description: 100 Ohm pull up enabled for POR_B always

Enum.name: POR_PULL_TYPE_1
Enum.description: Disable pull in SNVS mode, 100 Ohm pull up enabled otherwise

Enum.name: POR_PULL_TYPE_3
Enum.description: 100 Ohm pull down enabled in SNVS mode, 100 Ohm pull up enabled otherwise

Enum.name: DCDC_STS_DC_OK_0
Enum.description: DCDC is ramping up and not ready

Enum.name: ALT0
Enum.description: Select mux mode: ALT0 mux port: SNVS_LP_PMIC_ON_REQ of instance: snvs_lp

Enum.name: ALT5
Enum.description: Select mux mode: ALT5 mux port: GPIO5_IO01 of instance: gpio5

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Input Path is determined by functionality

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Force input path of pad PMIC_ON_REQ

Enum.name: GINT_0
Enum.description: Global interrupt request is not asserted

BitField.name: EXC_MON
BitField.description: Exclusive monitor response select of illegal command

BitField.name: CM7_FORCE_HCLK_EN
BitField.description: Arm CM7 platform AHB clock enable

Enum.name: CM7_FORCE_HCLK_EN_0
Enum.description: AHB clock is not running (gated) when CM7 is sleeping and TCM is not accessible

Enum.name: CM7_FORCE_HCLK_EN_1
Enum.description: AHB clock is running (enabled) when CM7 is sleeping and TCM is accessible

BitField.name: L2_MEM_EN_POWERSAVING
BitField.description: Enable power saving features on L2 memory

Enum.name: L2_MEM_EN_POWERSAVING_0
Enum.description: Enters power saving mode only when chip is in SUSPEND mode

BitField.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN
BitField.description: Automatically gate off RAM clock when RAM is not accessed.

Enum.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN_0
Enum.description: disable automatically gate off RAM clock

Enum.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN_1
Enum.description: enable automatically gate off RAM clock

BitField.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP
BitField.description: This bit controls how memory (OCRAM) enters Deep Sleep mode (shutdown periphery power, but maintain memory contents, outputs of memory are pulled low

Enum.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP_0
Enum.description: No force sleep control supported, memory deep sleep mode only entered when whole system in stop mode (OCRAM in normal mode)

Enum.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP_1
Enum.description: Force memory into deep sleep mode (OCRAM in power saving mode)

BitField.name: MQS_CLK_DIV
BitField.description: Divider ratio control for mclk from hmclk. mclk frequency = 1/(n+1) * hmclk frequency.

BitField.name: DCP_KEY_SEL
BitField.description: Select 128-bit DCP key from 256-bit key from SNVS Master Key

Enum.name: DCP_KEY_SEL_0
Enum.description: Select [127:0] from SNVS Master Key as DCP key

Enum.name: DCP_KEY_SEL_1
Enum.description: Select [255:128] from SNVS Master Key as DCP key

Enum.name: EDMA_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: EDMA stop acknowledge is not asserted

Enum.name: EDMA_STOP_ACK_1
Enum.description: EDMA stop acknowledge is asserted (EDMA is in STOP mode)

Enum.name: TRNG_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: TRNG stop acknowledge is not asserted

Enum.name: SAI1_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: SAI1 stop acknowledge is not asserted

Enum.name: SAI2_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: SAI2 stop acknowledge is not asserted

Enum.name: SAI3_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: SAI3 stop acknowledge is not asserted

Enum.name: PIT_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: PIT stop acknowledge is not asserted

Enum.name: FLEXSPI_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: FLEXSPI stop acknowledge is not asserted

Enum.name: FLEXIO1_STOP_ACK_0
Enum.description: FLEXIO1 stop acknowledge is not asserted

BitField.name: GPT2_CAPIN1_SEL
BitField.description: GPT2 input capture channel 1 source select

Enum.name: GPT2_CAPIN1_SEL_1
Enum.description: source from ENET_1588_EVENT3_OUT (chnnal 3 of IEEE 1588 timer)

Enum.name: VREF_1M_CLK_GPT1_0
Enum.description: GPT1 ipg_clk_highfreq driven by IPG_PERCLK. IPG_PERCLK is derived from either BUS clock or OSC_24M clock. See CCM chapter for more information

Enum.name: VREF_1M_CLK_GPT1_1

Enum.name: VREF_1M_CLK_GPT2_0

Enum.name: TCM_WWAIT_EN_0

Enum.name: TCM_RWAIT_EN_1

Enum.name: WDT_1
Enum.description: Assert WDOG_B upon a Watchdog Time-out event.

Enum.description: using original way to generate software reset (default)

Enum.name: SRE_1
Enum.description: using new way to generate software reset.

Enum.name: WSR_43690
Enum.description: Write to the Watchdog Service Register (WDOG_WSR).

Enum.name: SFTW_0
Enum.description: Reset is not the result of a software reset.

Enum.name: SFTW_1
Enum.description: Reset is the result of a software reset.

Enum.name: TOUT_0
Enum.description: Reset is not the result of a WDOG timeout.

Enum.name: TOUT_1
Enum.description: Reset is the result of a WDOG timeout.

Enum.name: POR_0
Enum.description: Reset is not the result of a power on reset.

Enum.name: POR_1
Enum.description: Reset is the result of a power on reset.

Enum.name: WICT_0
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 0 seconds.

Enum.name: WICT_1
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 0.5 seconds.

Enum.name: WICT_4
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 2 seconds (Default).

Enum.name: WICT_255
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 127.5 seconds.

Enum.name: PDE_0
Enum.description: Power Down Counter of WDOG is disabled.

Enum.name: PDE_1
Enum.description: Power Down Counter of WDOG is enabled (Default).

Enum.name: SRE_0
Enum.description: using original way to generate software reset (default)

Enum.name: SRE_1
Enum.description: using new way to generate software reset.

Enum.name: WSR_21845
Enum.description: Write to the Watchdog Service Register (WDOG_WSR).

Enum.name: WSR_43690
Enum.description: Write to the Watchdog Service Register (WDOG_WSR).

Enum.name: SFTW_0
Enum.description: Reset is not the result of a software reset.

Enum.name: SFTW_1
Enum.description: Reset is the result of a software reset.

Enum.name: TOUT_0
Enum.description: Reset is not the result of a WDOG timeout.

Enum.name: TOUT_1
Enum.description: Reset is the result of a WDOG timeout.

Enum.name: POR_0
Enum.description: Reset is not the result of a power on reset.

Enum.name: POR_1
Enum.description: Reset is the result of a power on reset.

Enum.name: WICT_0
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 0 seconds.

Enum.name: WICT_1
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 0.5 seconds.

Enum.name: WICT_4
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 2 seconds (Default).

Enum.name: WICT_255
Enum.description: WICT[7:0] = Time duration between interrupt and time-out is 127.5 seconds.

Enum.name: PDE_0
Enum.description: Power Down Counter of WDOG is disabled.

Enum.name: PDE_1
Enum.description: Power Down Counter of WDOG is enabled (Default).

Enum.name: STOP_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: DBG_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: DBG_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: TST_1
Enum.description: Watchdog user mode enabled. (Watchdog test mode disabled.) After testing the watchdog, software should use this setting to indicate that the watchdog is functioning normally in user mode.

Enum.name: TST_2
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the low byte is used. CNT[CNTLOW] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALLOW].

Enum.name: TST_3
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the high byte is used. CNT[CNTHIGH] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALHIGH].

Enum.name: UPDATE_0
Enum.description: Updates not allowed. After the initial configuration, the watchdog cannot be later modified without forcing a reset.

Enum.name: UPDATE_1
Enum.description: Updates allowed. Software can modify the watchdog configuration registers within 128 bus clocks after performing the unlock write sequence.

Enum.name: INT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are disabled. Watchdog resets are not delayed.

Enum.name: INT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are enabled. Watchdog resets are delayed by 128 bus clocks from the interrupt vector fetch.

BitField.name: CMD32EN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (otherwise 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

Enum.name: CMD32EN_0
Enum.description: Disables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. Only 16-bit or 8-bit is supported.

Enum.name: CMD32EN_1
Enum.description: Enables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. 16-bit or 8-bit is NOT supported.

BitField.name: CNTLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: CNTHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: TOVALLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the timeout value

BitField.name: TOVALHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the timeout value

Register.description: Data result register for HW triggers

Register.description: Data result register for HW triggers

Enum.name: ADLPC_0
Enum.description: ADC hard block not in low power mode.

Enum.name: ADLPC_1
Enum.description: ADC hard block in low power mode.

BitField.name: ADSTS
BitField.description: Defines the total sample time duration in number of full cycles

Enum.name: ADSTS_0
Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 3 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 13 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: ADSTS_1
Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 5 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 17 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: ADSTS_2
Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 7 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 21 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: ADSTS_3
Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 9 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 25 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: OVWREN_0
Enum.description: Disable the overwriting. Existing Data in Data result register will not be overwritten by subsequent converted data.

Enum.name: ADACKEN_0
Enum.description: Asynchronous clock output disabled; Asynchronous clock only enabled if selected by ADICLK and a conversion is active.

Enum.name: ADACKEN_1
Enum.description: Asynchronous clock and clock output enabled regardless of the state of the ADC

Enum.name: ACREN_0
Enum.description: Range function disabled. Only the compare value 1 of ADC_CV register (CV1) is compared.

Enum.name: ACREN_1
Enum.description: Range function enabled. Both compare values of ADC_CV registers (CV1 and CV2) are compared.

Enum.name: ACFGT_0
Enum.description: Configures "Less Than Threshold, Outside Range Not Inclusive and Inside Range Not Inclusive" functionality based on the values placed in the ADC_CV register.

Enum.name: ACFGT_1
Enum.description: Configures "Greater Than Or Equal To Threshold, Outside Range Inclusive and Inside Range Inclusive" functionality based on the values placed in the ADC_CV registers.

Enum.name: ADCO_0
Enum.description: One conversion or one set of conversions if the hardware average function is enabled (AVGE=1) after initiating a conversion.

Enum.name: ADCO_1
Enum.description: Continuous conversions or sets of conversions if the hardware average function is enabled (AVGE=1) after initiating a conversion.

Enum.name: CALF_1
Enum.description: Calibration failed. ADC accuracy specifications are not guaranteed.

Enum.name: AWKST_1
Enum.description: Asynchronous wake up interrupt occurred in stop mode.

Enum.name: SIGN_0
Enum.description: The offset value is added with the raw result

Enum.name: SIGN_1
Enum.description: The offset value is subtracted from the raw converted value

Enum.name: SAMP_MODE_VON_BOTH
Enum.description: use Von Neumann data into both Entropy shifter and Statistical Checker

Enum.name: SAMP_MODE_RAW_BOTH
Enum.description: use raw data into both Entropy shifter and Statistical Checker

Enum.name: SAMP_MODE_VON_ENT
Enum.description: use Von Neumann data into Entropy shifter. Use raw data into Statistical Checker

Enum.name: OSC_DIV_DIV1
Enum.description: use ring oscillator with no divide

BitField.name: UNUSED4
BitField.description: This bit is unused. Always reads zero.

BitField.name: UNUSED5
BitField.description: This bit is unused. Always reads zero.

BitField.name: TST_OUT
BitField.description: Read only: Test point inside ring oscillator.

BitField.name: LRUN_CONT

Enum.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

BitField.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL
BitField.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_CLEAR
Enum.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_ON
Enum.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

BitField.name: HW_ERR
BitField.description: Bit position that can be cleared or set to enable the corresponding bit of INT_STATUS to show interupt status

Enum.name: HW_ERR_MASKED
Enum.description: Corresponding interrupt of INT_STATUS is masked.

Enum.name: HW_ERR_ACTIVE
Enum.description: Corresponding bit of INT_STATUS is active.

BitField.name: ENT_VAL
BitField.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

Enum.name: ENT_VAL_MASKED
Enum.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

Enum.name: ENT_VAL_ACTIVE
Enum.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

BitField.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL
BitField.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_MASKED
Enum.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_ACTIVE
Enum.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

Enum.name: ENT_VAL_INVALID
Enum.description: Busy generation entropy. Any value read is invalid.

Enum.name: ENT_VAL_VALID
Enum.description: TRNG can be stopped and entropy is valid if read.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_NO_ERR
Enum.description: No hardware nor self test frequency errors.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_ERR
Enum.description: The frequency counter has detected a failure.

BitField.name: MIN_REV
BitField.description: Shows the IP's Minor revision of the TRNG.

BitField.name: MAJ_REV
BitField.description: Shows the IP's Major revision of the TRNG.

BitField.name: CONFIG_OPT
BitField.description: Shows the IP's Configuaration options for the TRNG.

BitField.name: ECO_REV
BitField.description: Shows the IP's ECO revision of the TRNG.

BitField.name: INTG_OPT
BitField.description: Shows the integration options for the TRNG

BitField.name: ERA
BitField.description: Shows the compile options for the TRNG.

BitField.name: ZMK_WSL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and the ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

BitField.name: ZMK_RSL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Soft Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK Registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

Enum.name: READ_ALLOWED
Enum.description: Read access is allowed (only in software Programming mode)

BitField.name: SRTC_SL
BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC Registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

BitField.name: LPCALB_SL
BitField.description: LP Calibration Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

BitField.name: MC_SL
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

BitField.name: GPR_SL
BitField.description: General Purpose Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

BitField.name: LPSVCR_SL
BitField.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

BitField.name: LPSECR_SL
BitField.description: LP Security Events Configuration Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSECR

BitField.name: MKS_SL
BitField.description: Master Key Select Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LPMKCR

BitField.name: HPSVCR_L
BitField.description: HP Security Violation Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSVCR

BitField.name: HPSICR_L
BitField.description: HP Security Interrupt Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSICR

BitField.name: HAC_L
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Lock When set, prevents any writes to HPHACIVR, HPHACR, and HAC_EN bit of HPCOMR

BitField.name: SSM_ST
BitField.description: SSM State Transition Transition state of the system security monitor

BitField.name: SSM_ST_DIS
BitField.description: SSM Secure to Trusted State Transition Disable When set, disables the SSM transition from secure to trusted state

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Secure to Trusted State transition is enabled

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Secure to Trusted State transition is disabled

BitField.name: SSM_SFNS_DIS
BitField.description: SSM Soft Fail to Non-Secure State Transition Disable When set, it disables the SSM transition from soft fail to non-secure state

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Soft Fail to Non-Secure State transition is enabled

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Soft Fail to Non-Secure State transition is disabled

BitField.name: LP_SWR
BitField.description: LP Software Reset When set to 1, most registers in the SNVS_LP section are reset, but the following registers are not reset by an LP software reset: Monotonic Counter Secure Real Time Counter Time Alarm Register This bit cannot be set when the LP_SWR_DIS bit is set

BitField.name: LP_SWR_DIS
BitField.description: LP Software Reset Disable When set, disables the LP software reset

BitField.name: SW_SV
BitField.description: Software Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a non-fatal security violation

BitField.name: SW_FSV
BitField.description: Software Fatal Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a fatal security violation

BitField.name: SW_LPSV
BitField.description: LP Software Security Violation When set, SNVS_LP treats this bit as a security violation

BitField.name: PROG_ZMK
BitField.description: Program Zeroizable Master Key This bit activates ZMK hardware programming mechanism

BitField.name: MKS_EN
BitField.description: Master Key Select Enable When not set, the one time programmable (OTP) master key is selected by default

Enum.name: SELECT_OTP
Enum.description: OTP master key is selected as an SNVS master key

Enum.name: SELECT_PER_LPMKCR
Enum.description: SNVS master key is selected according to the setting of the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of LPMKCR

BitField.name: HAC_EN
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Enable This bit controls the SSM transition from the soft fail to the hard fail state

BitField.name: HAC_LOAD
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Load When set, it loads the High Assurance Counter Register with the value of the High Assurance Counter Load Register

BitField.name: HAC_CLEAR
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Clear When set, it clears the High Assurance Counter Register

BitField.name: HAC_STOP
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Stop This bit can be set only when SSM is in soft fail state

BitField.name: NPSWA_EN
BitField.description: Non-Privileged Software Access Enable When set, allows non-privileged software to access all SNVS registers, including those that are privileged software read/write access only

BitField.name: HPTA_EN
BitField.description: HP Time Alarm Enable When set, the time alarm interrupt is generated if the value in the HP Time Alarm Registers is equal to the value of the HP Real Time Counter

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: HP Time Alarm Interrupt is disabled

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: HP Time Alarm Interrupt is enabled

BitField.name: DIS_PI
BitField.description: Disable periodic interrupt in the functional interrupt

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Periodic interrupt will trigger a functional interrupt

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Disable periodic interrupt in the function interrupt

BitField.name: PI_EN
BitField.description: HP Periodic Interrupt Enable The periodic interrupt can be generated only if the HP Real Time Counter is enabled

BitField.name: PI_FREQ
BitField.description: Periodic Interrupt Frequency Defines frequency of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_0
Enum.description: - bit 0 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_1
Enum.description: - bit 1 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_2
Enum.description: - bit 2 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_3
Enum.description: - bit 3 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_4
Enum.description: - bit 4 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_5
Enum.description: - bit 5 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_6
Enum.description: - bit 6 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_7
Enum.description: - bit 7 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_8
Enum.description: - bit 8 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_9
Enum.description: - bit 9 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_10
Enum.description: - bit 10 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_11
Enum.description: - bit 11 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_12
Enum.description: - bit 12 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_13
Enum.description: - bit 13 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_14
Enum.description: - bit 14 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: USE_BIT_1r5
Enum.description: - bit 15 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

BitField.name: HPCALB_EN
BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter Calibration Enabled Indicates that the time calibration mechanism is enabled.

BitField.name: HPCALB_VAL
BitField.description: HP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for the HP Real Time Counter

Enum.name: ADD_0_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +0 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: ADD_1_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: ADD_2_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: ADD_15_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: SUB_16_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -16 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: SUB_15_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: SUB_2_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: SUB_1_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: SYNC_TIME
Enum.description: Synchronize the HP Time Counter to the LP Time Counter

BitField.name: SV0_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 0 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 0 security violation

BitField.name: SV1_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 1 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 1 security violation

BitField.name: SV2_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 2 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 2 security violation

BitField.name: SV3_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 3 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 3 security violation

BitField.name: SV4_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 4 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 4 security violation

BitField.name: SV5_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 5 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 5 security violation

BitField.name: LPSVI_EN
BitField.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt Enable This bit enables generating of the security interrupt to the host processor upon security violation signal from the LP section

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt is Disabled

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt is Enabled

BitField.name: SV0_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 0 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 0 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: NON_FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: SV1_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 1 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 1 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: NON_FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: SV2_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 2 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 2 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: NON_FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: SV3_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 3 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 3 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: NON_FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: SV4_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 4 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 4 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: NON_FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: SV5_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 5 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 5 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: NON_FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: FATAL
Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: LPSV_CFG
BitField.description: LP Security Violation Configuration This field configures the LP security violation source.

Enum.name: NON_FATAL
Enum.description: LP security violation is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: FATAL
Enum.description: LP security violation is a fatal violation

BitField.name: HPTA
BitField.description: HP Time Alarm Indicates that the HP Time Alarm has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

BitField.name: PI
BitField.description: Periodic Interrupt Indicates that periodic interrupt has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

BitField.name: LPDIS
BitField.description: Low Power Disable If 1, the low power section has been disabled by means of an input signal to SNVS

BitField.name: BTN
BitField.description: Button Value of the BTN input

BitField.name: BI
BitField.description: Button Interrupt Signal ipi_snvs_btn_int_b was asserted.

BitField.name: SSM_STATE
BitField.description: System Security Monitor State This field contains the encoded state of the SSM's state machine

Enum.name: INTERMEDIATE
Enum.description: Init Intermediate (transition state between Init and Check - SSM stays in this state only one clock cycle)

BitField.name: SYS_SECURITY_CFG
BitField.description: System Security Configuration This field reflects the three security configuration inputs to SNVS

Enum.name: FAB_CONFIG
Enum.description: Fab Configuration - the default configuration of newly fabricated chips

Enum.name: OPEN_CONFIG
Enum.description: Open Configuration - the configuration after NXP-programmable fuses have been blown

Enum.name: CLOSED_CONFIG
Enum.description: Closed Configuration - the configuration after OEM-programmable fuses have been blown

Enum.name: FIELD_RETURN_CONFIG
Enum.description: Field Return Configuration - the configuration of chips that are returned to NXP for analysis

BitField.name: SYS_SECURE_BOOT
BitField.description: System Secure Boot If SYS_SECURE_BOOT is 1, the chip boots from internal ROM

BitField.name: OTPMK_SYNDROME
BitField.description: One Time Programmable Master Key Syndrome In the case of a single-bit error, the eight lower bits of this value indicate the bit number of error location

BitField.name: OTPMK_ZERO
BitField.description: One Time Programmable Master Key is Equal to Zero

BitField.name: ZMK_ZERO
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key is Equal to Zero

BitField.name: SV0
BitField.description: Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: No Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV1
BitField.description: Security Violation 1 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: No Security Violation 1 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV2
BitField.description: Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: No Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV3
BitField.description: Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: No Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV4
BitField.description: Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: No Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV5
BitField.description: Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: No Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SW_SV
BitField.description: Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_SV bit in the HP Command Register

BitField.name: SW_FSV
BitField.description: Software Fatal Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_FSV bit in the HP Command Register

BitField.name: SW_LPSV
BitField.description: LP Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_LPSV bit in the HP Command Register

BitField.name: ZMK_SYNDROME
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Syndrome The ZMK syndrome indicates the single-bit error location and parity for the ZMK register

BitField.name: ZMK_ECC_FAIL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Failure When set, this bit triggers a bad key violation to the SSM and a security violation to the SNVS_LP section, which clears security sensitive data

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: ZMK ECC Failure was not detected.

BitField.name: LP_SEC_VIO
BitField.description: LP Security Violation A security volation was detected in the SNVS low power section

Register.name: HPHACIVR
Register.description: SNVS_HP High Assurance Counter IV Register

BitField.name: HAC_COUNTER_IV
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Initial Value This register is used to set the starting count value to the high assurance counter

BitField.name: HAC_COUNTER
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter When the HAC_EN bit is set and the SSM is in the soft fail state, this counter starts to count down with the system clock

Register.name: HPRTCMR
Register.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter MSB Register

BitField.name: RTC
BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the RTC

Register.name: HPRTCLR
Register.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter LSB Register

BitField.name: RTC
BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits

BitField.name: ZMK_WHL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

BitField.name: ZMK_RHL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Hard Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

Enum.name: READ_ACCESS_ALLOWED
Enum.description: Read access is allowed (only in software programming mode).

BitField.name: SRTC_HL
BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

BitField.name: LPCALB_HL
BitField.description: LP Calibration Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

BitField.name: MC_HL
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

BitField.name: GPR_HL
BitField.description: General Purpose Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

BitField.name: LPSVCR_HL
BitField.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

BitField.name: LPSECR_HL
BitField.description: LP Security Events Configuration Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSECR

BitField.name: MKS_HL
BitField.description: Master Key Select Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LP Master Key Control Register

BitField.name: SRTC_ENV
BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the SRTC becomes operational

BitField.name: LPTA_EN
BitField.description: LP Time Alarm Enable When set, the SNVS functional interrupt is asserted if the LP Time Alarm Register is equal to the 32 MSBs of the secure real time counter

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: LP time alarm interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: LP time alarm interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: MC_ENV
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the MC can be incremented (by write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR)

BitField.name: LPWUI_EN
BitField.description: LP Wake-Up Interrupt Enable This interrupt line should be connected to the external pin and is intended to inform the external chip about an SNVS_LP event (MC rollover, SRTC rollover, or time alarm )

BitField.name: SRTC_INV_EN
BitField.description: If this bit is 1, in the case of a security violation the SRTC stops counting and the SRTC is invalidated (SRTC_ENV bit is cleared)

Enum.name: KEEP_VALID
Enum.description: SRTC stays valid in the case of security violation (other than a software violation (HPSVSR[SW_LPSV] = 1 or HPCOMR[SW_LPSV] = 1)).

Enum.name: INVALIDATE
Enum.description: SRTC is invalidated in the case of security violation.

BitField.name: DP_EN
BitField.description: Dumb PMIC Enabled When set, software can control the system power

BitField.name: TOP
BitField.description: Turn off System Power Asserting this bit causes a signal to be sent to the Power Management IC to turn off the system power

BitField.name: LVD_EN
BitField.description: Digital Low-Voltage Event Enable By default the detection of a low-voltage event does not cause the pmic_en_b signal to be asserted

BitField.name: LPCALB_EN
BitField.description: LP Calibration Enable When set, enables the SRTC calibration mechanism

BitField.name: LPCALB_VAL
BitField.description: LP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for SRTC

Enum.name: ADD_0_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +0 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: ADD_1_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: ADD_2_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: ADD_15_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: +15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: SUB_16_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -16 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: SUB_15_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: SUB_2_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: SUB_1_PER_32768_TICKS
Enum.description: -1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

BitField.name: BTN_PRESS_TIME
BitField.description: This field configures the button press time out values for the PMIC Logic

BitField.name: DEBOUNCE
BitField.description: This field configures the amount of debounce time for the BTN input signal

BitField.name: ON_TIME
BitField.description: The ON_TIME field is used to configure the period of time after BTN is asserted before pmic_en_b is asserted to turn on the SoC power

BitField.name: PK_EN
BitField.description: PMIC On Request Enable The value written to PK_EN will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_en

BitField.name: PK_OVERRIDE
BitField.description: PMIC On Request Override The value written to PK_OVERRIDE will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_override

BitField.name: MASTER_KEY_SEL
BitField.description: Master Key Select These bits select the SNVS Master Key output when Master Key Select bits are enabled by MKS_EN bit in the HPCOMR

Enum.name: SELECT_OTPMK
Enum.description: Select one time programmable master key.

Enum.name: SELECT_ZMK
Enum.description: Select zeroizable master key when MKS_EN bit is set .

Enum.name: SELECT_COMBO
Enum.description: Select combined master key when MKS_EN bit is set .

BitField.name: ZMK_HWP
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key hardware Programming mode When set, only the hardware key programming mechanism can set the ZMK and software cannot read it

Enum.name: SW_PROG_MODE
Enum.description: ZMK is in the software programming mode.

Enum.name: HW_PROG_MODE
Enum.description: ZMK is in the hardware programming mode.

BitField.name: ZMK_VAL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Valid When set, the ZMK value can be selected by the master key control block for use by cryptographic modules

BitField.name: ZMK_ECC_EN
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Enable Writing one to this field automatically calculates and sets the ZMK ECC value in the ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of this register

BitField.name: ZMK_ECC_VALUE
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Value This field is automatically calculated and set when one is written into ZMK_ECC_EN bit of this register

BitField.name: SV0_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 0 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 0 Input

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV1_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 1 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 1 Input

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV2_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 2 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 2 Input

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV3_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 3 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 3 Input

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV4_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 4 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 4 Input

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV5_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 5 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 5 Input

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SRTCR_EN
BitField.description: SRTC Rollover Enable When set, an SRTC rollover event generates an LP security violation.

BitField.name: MCR_EN
BitField.description: MC Rollover Enable When set, an MC Rollover event generates an LP security violation.

BitField.name: PFD_OBSERV
BitField.description: System Power Fail Detector (PFD) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the inverted output of the PFD analog circuitry (external to the SNVS block)

BitField.name: POR_OBSERV
BitField.description: Power On Reset (POR) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the output of the POR analog circuitry (external to the SNVS

BitField.name: LTDC
BitField.description: Low Temp Detect Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module.

BitField.name: HTDC
BitField.description: High Temperature Detect Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module

BitField.name: VRC
BitField.description: Voltage Reference Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module.

BitField.name: OSCB
BitField.description: Oscillator Bypass When OSCB=1 the osc_bypass signal is asserted

Enum.name: NOT_BYPASSED
Enum.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator not bypassed.

Enum.name: BYPASSED
Enum.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator bypassed. Alternate clock can drive the SRTC clock source.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: SRTC has not reached its maximum value.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: SRTC has reached its maximum value.

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: MC has not reached its maximum value.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: MC has reached its maximum value.

BitField.name: ESVD
BitField.description: External Security Violation Detected Indicates that a security violation is detected on one of the HP security violation ports

BitField.name: EO
BitField.description: Emergency Off This bit is set when a power off is requested.

BitField.name: SPOF
BitField.description: Set Power Off The SPO bit is set when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: Set Power Off was not detected.

BitField.name: SPON
BitField.description: Set Power On The SPON bit is set when the set_pwr_on_irq interrupt is triggered, which happens when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time

Enum.name: NOREPORT
Enum.description: Set Power On Interrupt was not detected.

Enum.name: REPORTED
Enum.description: Set Power On Interrupt was detected.

BitField.name: LPNS
BitField.description: LP Section is Non-Secured Indicates that LP section was provisioned/programmed in the non-secure state

Enum.name: NOT_PRGRMD_IN_NON_SECURE_STATE
Enum.description: LP section was not programmed in the non-secure state.

Enum.name: WAS_PRGRMD_IN_NON_SECURE_STATE
Enum.description: LP section was programmed in the non-secure state.

BitField.name: LPS
BitField.description: LP Section is Secured Indicates that the LP section is provisioned/programmed in the secure or trusted state

Enum.name: NOT_PRGRMD_IN_SECURE_OR_TRUSTED_STATE
Enum.description: LP section was not programmed in secure or trusted state.

Enum.name: WAS_PRGRMD_IN_SECURE_OR_TRUSTED_STATE
Enum.description: LP section was programmed in secure or trusted state.

Register.name: LPSRTCMR
Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter MSB Register

BitField.name: SRTC
BitField.description: LP Secure Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the SRTC

Register.name: LPSRTCLR
Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter LSB Register

BitField.name: SRTC
BitField.description: LP Secure Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits This register can be programmed only when SRTC is not active and not locked, meaning the SRTC_ENV, SRTC_SL, and SRTC_HL bits are not set

BitField.name: LPTA
BitField.description: LP Time Alarm This register can be programmed only when the LP time alarm is disabled (LPTA_EN bit is not set)

Register.name: LPSMCMR
Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter MSB Register

BitField.name: MON_COUNTER
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter most-significant 16 Bits Note that writing to this register does not change the value of this field to the value that was written

BitField.name: MC_ERA_BITS
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Era Bits These bits are inputs to the module and typically connect to fuses

Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter LSB Register

BitField.name: MON_COUNTER
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter bits Note that writing to this register does not change the value of this field to the value that was written

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ
BitField.description: Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0
Enum.description: All analog except RTC powered down on stop mode assertion.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1
Enum.description: Beside RTC, analog bandgap, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2
Enum.description: Beside RTC, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on, low-power bandgap is selected so that the normal analog bandgap together with the rest analog is powered down.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3
Enum.description: Beside RTC, low-power bandgap is selected and the rest analog is powered down.

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK
BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN
BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL
BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.

Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY
BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE
BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ
BitField.description: Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0
Enum.description: All analog except RTC powered down on stop mode assertion.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1
Enum.description: Beside RTC, analog bandgap, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2
Enum.description: Beside RTC, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on, low-power bandgap is selected so that the normal analog bandgap together with the rest analog is powered down.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3
Enum.description: Beside RTC, low-power bandgap is selected and the rest analog is powered down.

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

BitField.name: PFD_480_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_480 clocks anytime the USB1_PLL_480 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: PFD_528_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_528 clocks anytime the PLL_528 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPPANIC
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor panic interrupt asserts for a panic high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPLOW
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor low interrupt asserts for low temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPHIGH
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor high interrupt asserts for high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_ANA_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the analog regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: IRQ_DIG_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the digital regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: REG0_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the CORE power domain

BitField.name: REG0_BO_STATUS
BitField.description: Reg0 brownout status bit.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

Enum.name: REG0_BO_STATUS_1
Enum.description: Brownout, supply is below target minus brownout offset.

BitField.name: REG0_ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Enables the brownout detection.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG0_OK
BitField.description: Arm supply Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: PLL3_DISABLE
BitField.description: When USB is in low power suspend mode this Control bit is used to indicate if other system peripherals require the USB PLL3 clock when the SoC is not in low power mode

Enum.name: PLL3_DISABLE_0
Enum.description: PLL3 is being used by peripherals and is enabled when SoC is not in any low power mode

Enum.name: PLL3_DISABLE_1
Enum.description: PLL3 can be disabled when the SoC is not in any low power mode

BitField.name: REG1_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the xPU power domain

BitField.name: REG1_BO_STATUS
BitField.description: Reg1 brownout status bit. Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

Enum.name: REG1_BO_STATUS_1
Enum.description: Brownout, supply is below target minus brownout offset.

BitField.name: REG1_ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Enables the brownout detection.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG1_OK
BitField.description: GPU supply Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: AUDIO_DIV_LSB
BitField.description: LSB of Post-divider for Audio PLL

BitField.name: REG2_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the xPU power domain

BitField.name: REG2_BO_STATUS
BitField.description: Reg2 brownout status bit.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG2_ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Enables the brownout detection.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG2_OK
BitField.description: Signals that the voltage is above the brownout level for the SOC supply

BitField.name: AUDIO_DIV_MSB
BitField.description: MSB of Post-divider for Audio PLL

BitField.name: REG0_STEP_TIME
BitField.description: Number of clock periods (24MHz clock).Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG1_STEP_TIME
BitField.description: Number of clock periods (24MHz clock).Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG2_STEP_TIME
BitField.description: Number of clock periods (24MHz clock).Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: ENABLE_LINREG
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the regulator output.

BitField.name: ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the brownout circuitry in the regulator.

BitField.name: ENABLE_ILIMIT
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the current-limit circuitry in the regulator.

BitField.name: ENABLE_PULLDOWN
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the pull-down circuitry in the regulator

BitField.name: BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator brownout offset voltage in 25mV steps

BitField.name: OUTPUT_TRG
BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator output voltage

BitField.name: BO_VDD1P1
BitField.description: Status bit that signals when a brownout is detected on the regulator output.

BitField.name: OK_VDD1P1
BitField.description: Status bit that signals when the regulator output is ok. 1 = regulator output > brownout target

BitField.name: SELREF_WEAK_LINREG
BitField.description: Selects the source for the reference voltage of the weak 1p1 regulator.

BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator brownout offset voltage in 25mV steps

BitField.name: OUTPUT_TRG
BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator output voltage

BitField.name: BO_VDD1P1
BitField.description: Status bit that signals when a brownout is detected on the regulator output.

BitField.name: OK_VDD1P1
BitField.description: Status bit that signals when the regulator output is ok. 1 = regulator output > brownout target

BitField.name: SELREF_WEAK_LINREG
BitField.description: Selects the source for the reference voltage of the weak 1p1 regulator.

BitField.name: ENABLE_LINREG
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the regulator output to be set by the programmed target voltage setting and internal bandgap reference

BitField.name: ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the brownout circuitry in the regulator.

BitField.name: ENABLE_ILIMIT
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the current-limit circuitry in the regulator.

BitField.name: BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator brownout offset voltage in 25mV steps

BitField.name: VBUS_SEL
BitField.description: Select input voltage source for LDO_3P0 from either USB_OTG1_VBUS or USB_OTG2_VBUS

BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator output voltage

BitField.name: OK_VDD3P0
BitField.description: Status bit that signals when the regulator output is ok. 1 = regulator output > brownout target

BitField.name: REG0_TARG
BitField.description: This field defines the target voltage for the Arm core power domain

Enum.name: REG0_TARG_31
Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.

BitField.name: REG0_ADJ
BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg0. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

BitField.name: REG1_TARG
BitField.description: This bit field defines the target voltage for the vpu/gpu power domain. Single bit increments reflect 25mV core voltage steps. Not all steps will make sense to use either because of input supply limitations or load operation.

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_31
Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.

BitField.name: REG1_ADJ
BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg1. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

BitField.name: REG2_TARG
BitField.description: This field defines the target voltage for the SOC power domain

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_31
Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.

BitField.name: REG2_ADJ
BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg2. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

BitField.name: FET_ODRIVE
BitField.description: If set, increases the gate drive on power gating FETs to reduce leakage in the off state

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWDVBGUP
BitField.description: Control bit to power down the VBG-up detection circuitry in the analog bandgap.

BitField.name: REFTOP_LOWPOWER
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the low-power mode in the analog bandgap.

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable. 1 - Stable.

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK
BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN
BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL
BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.

Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY
BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE
BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWDVBGUP

BitField.name: PFD_480_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_480 clocks anytime the USB1_PLL_480 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: PFD_528_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_528 clocks anytime the PLL_528 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPPANIC
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor panic interrupt asserts for a panic high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPLOW
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor low interrupt asserts for low temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPHIGH
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor high interrupt asserts for high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_ANA_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the analog regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: IRQ_DIG_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the digital regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: REG0_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the CORE power domain

Enum.name: REG0_BO_STATUS_1
Enum.description: Brownout, supply is below target minus brownout offset.

BitField.name: REG1_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the xPU power domain

Enum.name: REG1_BO_STATUS_1
Enum.description: Brownout, supply is below target minus brownout offset.

BitField.name: AUDIO_DIV_LSB
BitField.description: LSB of Post-divider for Audio PLL

BitField.name: REG2_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the xPU power domain

BitField.name: REG2_OK
BitField.description: Signals that the voltage is above the brownout level for the SOC supply

BitField.name: AUDIO_DIV_MSB

BitField.name: POWER_DOWN
BitField.description: This bit powers down the temperature sensor.

Enum.name: POWER_UP
Enum.description: Enable power to the temperature sensor.

Enum.name: STOP
Enum.description: Do not start the measurement process.

BitField.name: FINISHED
BitField.description: Indicates that the latest temp is valid

Enum.name: INVALID
Enum.description: Last measurement is not ready yet.

BitField.name: TEMP_CNT
BitField.description: This bit field contains the last measured temperature count.

BitField.name: ALARM_VALUE
BitField.description: This bit field contains the temperature count (raw sensor output) that will generate a high alarm when TEMP_CNT is smaller than this field

BitField.name: CHK_CONTACT
BitField.description: Check the contact of USB plug

Enum.name: NO_CHECK
Enum.description: Do not check the contact of USB plug.

Enum.name: CHECK
Enum.description: Check whether the USB plug has been in contact with each other

Enum.name: CHECK
Enum.description: Check whether a charger (either a dedicated charger or a host charger) is connected to USB port.

Enum.name: NO_CHECK
Enum.description: Do not check whether a charger is connected to the USB port.

BitField.name: BVALID
BitField.description: Indicates VBus is valid for a B-peripheral

BitField.name: AVALID
BitField.description: Indicates VBus is valid for a A-peripheral

BitField.name: PLUG_CONTACT
BitField.description: State of the USB plug contact detector.

Enum.name: NO_CONTACT
Enum.description: The USB plug has not made contact.

Enum.name: GOOD_CONTACT
Enum.description: The USB plug has made good contact.

BitField.name: CHRG_DETECTED
BitField.description: State of charger detection. This bit is a read only version of the state of the analog signal.

Enum.name: CHARGER_NOT_PRESENT
Enum.description: The USB port is not connected to a charger.

Enum.name: CHARGER_PRESENT
Enum.description: A charger (either a dedicated charger or a host charger) is connected to the USB port.

BitField.name: DM_STATE
BitField.description: DM line state output of the charger detector.

BitField.name: DP_STATE
BitField.description: DP line state output of the charger detector.

BitField.name: HS_USE_EXTERNAL_R
BitField.description: Use external resistor to generate the current bias for the high speed transmitter

BitField.name: EN_DEGLITCH
BitField.description: Enable the deglitching circuit of the USB PLL output.

BitField.name: EN_CLK_UTMI
BitField.description: Enables the clk to the UTMI block.

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode. Not related to oscillator.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0
Enum.description: All analog except rtc powered down on stop mode assertion. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1
Enum.description: Certain analog functions such as certain regulators left up. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2
Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=on, New BG=off.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3
Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=off, New BG=on.

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK
BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN
BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL
BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.

Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY
BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE
BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

BitField.name: VID_PLL_PREDIV
BitField.description: Predivider for the source clock of the PLL's. Not related to oscillator.

BitField.name: L1_PWRGATE
BitField.description: L1 power gate control. Used as software override. Not related to oscillator.

BitField.name: L2_PWRGATE
BitField.description: L2 power gate control. Used as software override. Not related to oscillator.

BitField.name: CPU_PWRGATE
BitField.description: CPU power gate control. Used as software override. Test purpose only Not related to oscillator.

BitField.name: DISPLAY_PWRGATE
BitField.description: Display logic power gate control. Used as software override. Not related to oscillator.

BitField.name: XTALOSC_PWRUP_DELAY
BitField.description: Specifies the time delay between when the 24MHz xtal is powered up until it is stable and ready to use

BitField.name: MIX_PWRGATE
BitField.description: Display power gate control. Used as software mask. Set to zero to force ungated.

BitField.name: GPU_PWRGATE
BitField.description: GPU power gate control. Used as software mask. Set to zero to force ungated.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start/stop bit for the RC tuning calculation logic. If stopped the tuning logic is reset.

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enables the tuning logic to calculate new RC tuning values

BitField.name: BYPASS
BitField.description: Bypasses any calculated RC tuning value and uses the programmed register value.

BitField.name: INVERT
BitField.description: Invert the stepping of the calculated RC tuning value.

BitField.name: RC_OSC_PROG_CUR
BitField.description: The current tuning value in use.

BitField.name: COUNT_1M_TRG
BitField.description: The target count used to tune the 1MHz clock frequency

BitField.name: ENABLE_1M
BitField.description: Enable the 1MHz clock output. 0 - disabled; 1 - enabled.

BitField.name: MUX_1M
BitField.description: Mux the corrected or uncorrected 1MHz clock to the output

BitField.name: CLK_1M_ERR_FL
BitField.description: Flag indicates that the count_1m count wasn't reached within 1 32kHz period

BitField.name: RSVD0
BitField.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.

BitField.name: TXCAL45DN
BitField.description: Decode to select a 45-Ohm resistance to the USB_DN output pin

BitField.name: RSVD1
BitField.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.

BitField.name: TXCAL45DP
BitField.description: Decode to select a 45-Ohm resistance to the USB_DP output pin

BitField.name: USBPHY_TX_EDGECTRL
BitField.description: Controls the edge-rate of the current sensing transistors used in HS transmit
