Enum.name: CLEAR_OFLAG
Enum.description: Clear OFLAG output on successful compare

Enum.name: SET_OFLAG
Enum.description: Set OFLAG output on successful compare

Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_SUCCESS
Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output on successful compare

Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_ALT
Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output using alternating compare registers

Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_SECONDARY
Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on secondary source input edge

Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_ROLLOVER
Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on counter rollover

Enum.name: ENABLE_GATED_OUT
Enum.description: Enable gated clock output while counter is active

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers cannot force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers may force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

Enum.name: UNTIL_ROLLOVER
Enum.description: Count until roll over at $FFFF and continue from $0000.

Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
Enum.description: Count until compare, then re-initialize. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, alternating values of COMP1 and COMP2 are used to generate successful comparisons. For example, the counter counts until a COMP1 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP2 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP1 value is reached, and so on.

Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
Enum.description: Count until compare and then stop. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, the counter re-initializes after reaching the COMP1 value, continues to count to the COMP2 value, and then stops.

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY1
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 1 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY2
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 2 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY4
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 4 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY8
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 8 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY16
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 16 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY32
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 32 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY64
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 64 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY128
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 128 prescaler

Enum.name: RISING_ONLY
Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary sourceRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1. If the primary count source is IP bus clock divide by 1, only rising edges are counted regardless of the value of SCTRL[IPS].

Enum.name: RISING_AND_FALLING
Enum.description: Count rising and falling edges of primary sourceIP bus clock divide by 1 cannot be used as a primary count source in edge count mode.

Enum.name: RISING_WHILE_SEC_HIGH
Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source while secondary input high active

Enum.name: QUADRATURE
Enum.description: Quadrature count mode, uses primary and secondary sources

Enum.name: RISING_SEC_DIR
Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source; secondary source specifies directionRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1.

Enum.name: SECONDARY
Enum.description: Edge of secondary source triggers primary count until compare

Enum.name: CASCADE
Enum.description: Cascaded counter mode (up/down)The primary count source must be set to one of the counter outputs.

Register.name: SCTRL0
Register.description: Timer Channel Status and Control Register

Enum.name: INPUT
Enum.description: The external pin is configured as an input.

Enum.name: OFLAG_OUT
Enum.description: The OFLAG output signal is driven on the external pin. Other timer groups using this external pin as their input see the driven value. The polarity of the signal is determined by OPS.

Enum.name: ENABLE_RISING
Enum.description: Load capture register on rising edge (when IPS=0) or falling edge (when IPS=1) of input

Enum.name: ENABLE_FALLING
Enum.description: Load capture register on falling edge (when IPS=0) or rising edge (when IPS=1) of input

Enum.name: ENABLE_BOTH
Enum.description: Load capture register on both edges of input

Register.name: CSCTRL0
Register.description: Timer Channel Comparator Status and Control Register

Enum.name: COMP1
Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1

Enum.name: COMP2
Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2

Enum.name: COMP1
Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1

Enum.name: COMP2
Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: The last count was in the DOWN direction.

Enum.name: UP
Enum.description: The last count was in the UP direction.

Enum.name: STOP
Enum.description: Stop counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.

Enum.name: RELOAD
Enum.description: Reload the counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Do not reload the counter on a capture event.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Reload the counter on a capture event.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Counter can be re-initialized only with the LOAD register.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Counter can be re-initialized with the LOAD or CMPLD2 registers depending on count direction.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Continue with normal operation during debug mode. (default)

Enum.name: HALT_TMR
Enum.description: Halt TMR counter during debug mode.

Enum.name: FORCE_0
Enum.description: Force TMR output to logic 0 (prior to consideration of SCTRL[OPS]).

Enum.name: HALT_AND_FORCE_0
Enum.description: Both halt counter and force output to 0 during debug mode.

Enum.name: CLEAR_OFLAG
Enum.description: Clear OFLAG output on successful compare

Enum.name: SET_OFLAG
Enum.description: Set OFLAG output on successful compare

Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_SUCCESS
Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output on successful compare

Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_ALT
Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output using alternating compare registers

Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_SECONDARY
Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on secondary source input edge

Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_ROLLOVER
Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on counter rollover

Enum.name: ENABLE_GATED_OUT
Enum.description: Enable gated clock output while counter is active

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers cannot force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers may force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

Enum.name: UNTIL_ROLLOVER
Enum.description: Count until roll over at $FFFF and continue from $0000.

Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
Enum.description: Count until compare, then re-initialize. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, alternating values of COMP1 and COMP2 are used to generate successful comparisons. For example, the counter counts until a COMP1 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP2 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP1 value is reached, and so on.

Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
Enum.description: Count until compare and then stop. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, the counter re-initializes after reaching the COMP1 value, continues to count to the COMP2 value, and then stops.

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY1
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 1 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY2
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 2 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY4
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 4 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY8
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 8 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY16
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 16 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY32
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 32 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY64
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 64 prescaler

Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY128
Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 128 prescaler

Enum.name: RISING_ONLY
Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary sourceRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1. If the primary count source is IP bus clock divide by 1, only rising edges are counted regardless of the value of SCTRL[IPS].

Enum.name: RISING_AND_FALLING
Enum.description: Count rising and falling edges of primary sourceIP bus clock divide by 1 cannot be used as a primary count source in edge count mode.

Enum.name: RISING_WHILE_SEC_HIGH
Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source while secondary input high active

Enum.name: QUADRATURE
Enum.description: Quadrature count mode, uses primary and secondary sources

Enum.name: RISING_SEC_DIR
Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source; secondary source specifies directionRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1.

Enum.name: SECONDARY
Enum.description: Edge of secondary source triggers primary count until compare

Enum.name: CASCADE
Enum.description: Cascaded counter mode (up/down)The primary count source must be set to one of the counter outputs.

Register.name: SCTRL1
Register.description: Timer Channel Status and Control Register

Enum.name: INPUT
Enum.description: The external pin is configured as an input.

Enum.name: OFLAG_OUT
Enum.description: The OFLAG output signal is driven on the external pin. Other timer groups using this external pin as their input see the driven value. The polarity of the signal is determined by OPS.

Enum.name: ENABLE_RISING
Enum.description: Load capture register on rising edge (when IPS=0) or falling edge (when IPS=1) of input

Enum.name: ENABLE_FALLING
Enum.description: Load capture register on falling edge (when IPS=0) or rising edge (when IPS=1) of input

Enum.name: ENABLE_BOTH
Enum.description: Load capture register on both edges of input

BitField.name: EN_24M
BitField.description: Enable 24 MHz clock input from crystal

Enum.name: SWR_0
Enum.description: GPT is not in reset state

BitField.name: IM2
BitField.description: IM2 (bits 19-18, Input Capture Channel 2 operating mode) IM1 (bits 17-16, Input Capture Channel 1 operating mode) The IMn bit field determines the transition on the input pin (for Input capture channel n), which will trigger a capture event

BitField.name: OM3
BitField.description: OM3 (bits 28-26) controls the Output Compare Channel 3 operating mode

Enum.name: OM3_0
Enum.description: Output disconnected. No response on pin.

Enum.name: OM3_4
Enum.description: Generate an active low pulse (that is one input clock wide) on the output pin.

BitField.name: FO3
BitField.description: FO3 Force Output Compare Channel 3 FO2 Force Output Compare Channel 2 FO1 Force Output Compare Channel 1 The FOn bit causes the pin action programmed for the timer Output Compare n pin (according to the OMn bits in this register)

Enum.name: FO3_1
Enum.description: Causes the programmed pin action on the timer Output Compare n pin; the OFn flag is not set.

BitField.name: OF3
BitField.description: OF3 Output Compare 3 Flag OF2 Output Compare 2 Flag OF1 Output Compare 1 Flag The OFn bit indicates that a compare event has occurred on Output Compare channel n

BitField.name: IF2
BitField.description: IF2 Input capture 2 Flag IF1 Input capture 1 Flag The IFn bit indicates that a capture event has occurred on Input Capture channel n

BitField.name: OF3IE
BitField.description: OF3IE Output Compare 3 Interrupt Enable OF2IE Output Compare 2 Interrupt Enable OF1IE Output Compare 1 Interrupt Enable The OFnIE bit controls the Output Compare Channel n interrupt

Enum.name: OF3IE_0
Enum.description: Output Compare Channel n interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: OF3IE_1
Enum.description: Output Compare Channel n interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: IF2IE
BitField.description: IF2IE Input capture 2 Interrupt Enable IF1IE Input capture 1 Interrupt Enable The IFnIE bit controls the IFnIE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: IF2IE_0
Enum.description: IF2IE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable is disabled.

Enum.name: IF2IE_1
Enum.description: IF2IE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable is enabled.

BitField.name: ROVIE
BitField.description: Rollover Interrupt Enable. The ROVIE bit controls the Rollover interrupt.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Counter Value. The COUNT bits show the current count value of the GPT counter.

Enum.name: ENMOD_0
Enum.description: GPT counter will retain its value when it is disabled.

Enum.name: ENMOD_1
Enum.description: GPT counter value is reset to 0 when it is disabled.

Enum.name: DBGEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: WAITEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in wait mode.

Enum.name: WAITEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in wait mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in doze mode.

Enum.name: STOPEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in Stop mode.

Enum.name: STOPEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in Stop mode.

Register.name: HW_OCOTP_CTRL
Register.description: OTP Controller Control and Status Register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: OTP write and read access address register

Enum.name: not_busy
Enum.description: No write or read access to OTP started.

Enum.name: busy
Enum.description: Write or read access to OTP started.

Enum.name: error
Enum.description: Error - access to a locked region requested.

Enum.name: shadow_noforce_reload
Enum.description: Do not force shadow register re-load.

Enum.name: shadow_force_reload
Enum.description: Force shadow register re-load. This bit is cleared automatically after shadow registers are re-loaded.

Register.name: HW_OCOTP_CTRL_SET
Register.description: OTP Controller Control and Status Register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: OTP write and read access address register

Register.name: HW_OCOTP_CTRL_CLR
Register.description: OTP Controller Control and Status Register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: OTP write and read access address register

Register.name: HW_OCOTP_CTRL_TOG
Register.description: OTP Controller Control and Status Register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: OTP write and read access address register

Enum.name: notblocked
Enum.description: The writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are not blocked.

Enum.name: blocked
Enum.description: The writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are blocked. Once this bit is set, it is always high unless a POR is issued.

Enum.name: notblocked
Enum.description: Writing to this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are not blocked.

Enum.name: blocked
Enum.description: Writing to this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are blocked. Once this bit is set, it is always high unless a POR is issued.

Enum.name: jtag_dbg_dis
Enum.description: JTAG debugging is not enabled by the HAB (it may still be enabled by other mechanisms).

Enum.name: jtag_dbg_en
Enum.description: JTAG debugging is enabled by the HAB (though this signal may be gated off).

Enum.name: unlocked
Enum.description: Bits in this register are unlocked.

Enum.name: locked
Enum.description: Bits in this register are locked. When set, all of the bits in this register are locked and can not be changed through SW programming. After this bit is set, it can only be cleared by a POR.

Register.name: HW_OCOTP_LOCK
Register.description: Value of OTP Bank0 Word0 (Lock controls)

Enum.name: notblocked
Enum.description: The writing or reading of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are not blocked.

Enum.name: blocked
Enum.description: When set, the writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are blocked. The read of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are also blocked

Enum.name: notblocked
Enum.description: Writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are not blocked.

Enum.name: blocked
Enum.description: When set, the writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are blocked.

Enum.name: notblocked
Enum.description: Writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are not blocked.

Enum.name: blocked
Enum.description: When set, the writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are blocked.

Enum.name: notblocked
Enum.description: Writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are not blocked.

Enum.name: blocked
Enum.description: When set, the writing of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are blocked.

Enum.name: notblocked
Enum.description: The reading of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are not blocked.

Enum.name: blocked
Enum.description: When set, the reading of this region's shadow register and OTP fuse word are blocked.

Enum.name: functional
Enum.description: The device is a functional part.

Enum.name: field_returned
Enum.description: The device is a field returned part.

Enum.name: KRE_0
Enum.description: Row is not included in the keypad key press detect.

Enum.name: KRE_1
Enum.description: Row is included in the keypad key press detect.

Enum.name: TOTEM_POLE
Enum.description: Column strobe output is totem pole drive.

Enum.name: OPEN_DRAIN
Enum.description: Column strobe output is open drain.

Enum.name: KDSC_1
Enum.description: Set bits that clear the keypad depress synchronizer chain

Enum.name: KRSS_1
Enum.description: Set bits which sets keypad release synchronizer chain

Enum.name: KDIE_0
Enum.description: No interrupt request is generated when KPKD is set.

Enum.name: KDIE_1
Enum.description: An interrupt request is generated when KPKD is set.

Enum.name: KRIE_0
Enum.description: No interrupt request is generated when KPKR is set.

Enum.name: KRIE_1
Enum.description: An interrupt request is generated when KPKR is set.

Enum.name: INPUT
Enum.description: ROWn pin configured as an input.

Enum.name: OUTPUT
Enum.description: ROWn pin configured as an output.

Enum.name: INPUT
Enum.description: COLn pin is configured as an input.

Enum.name: OUTPUT
Enum.description: COLn pin is configured as an output.

BitField.name: RXCLKSRC
BitField.description: Sample Clock source selection for Flash Reading

Enum.name: RXCLKSRC_0
Enum.description: Dummy Read strobe generated by FlexSPI Controller and loopback internally.

Enum.name: RXCLKSRC_1
Enum.description: Dummy Read strobe generated by FlexSPI Controller and loopback from DQS pad.

Enum.name: RXCLKSRC_3
Enum.description: Flash provided Read strobe and input from DQS pad

BitField.name: ARDFEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus Read Access to IP RX FIFO.

Enum.name: ARDFEN_0
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO should be read by IP Bus. AHB Bus read access to IP RX FIFO memory space will get bus error response.

Enum.name: ARDFEN_1
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO should be read by AHB Bus. IP Bus read access to IP RX FIFO memory space will always return data zero but no bus error response.

BitField.name: ATDFEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus Write Access to IP TX FIFO.

Enum.name: ATDFEN_0
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO should be written by IP Bus. AHB Bus write access to IP TX FIFO memory space will get bus error response.

Enum.name: ATDFEN_1
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO should be written by AHB Bus. IP Bus write access to IP TX FIFO memory space will be ignored but no bus error response.

BitField.name: SERCLKDIV
BitField.description: The serial root clock could be divided inside FlexSPI . See Clocks section for more details on clocking.

BitField.name: HSEN
BitField.description: Half Speed Serial Flash access Enable.

Enum.name: HSEN_0
Enum.description: Disable divide by 2 of serial flash clock for half speed commands.

Enum.name: HSEN_1
Enum.description: Enable divide by 2 of serial flash clock for half speed commands.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: Doze mode support disabled. AHB clock and serial clock will not be gated off when there is doze mode request from system.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: Doze mode support enabled. AHB clock and serial clock will be gated off when there is doze mode request from system.

BitField.name: COMBINATIONEN
BitField.description: This bit is to support Flash Octal mode access by combining Port A and B Data pins (A_DATA[3:0] and B_DATA[3:0]), when Port A and Port B are of 4 bit data width.

BitField.name: SCKFREERUNEN
BitField.description: This bit is used to force SCLK output free-running. For FPGA applications, external device may use SCLK as reference clock to its internal PLL. If SCLK free-running is enabled, data sampling with loopback clock from SCLK pad is not supported (MCR0[RXCLKSRC]=2).

BitField.name: IPGRANTWAIT
BitField.description: Time out wait cycle for IP command grant.

BitField.name: AHBGRANTWAIT
BitField.description: Timeout wait cycle for AHB command grant.

BitField.name: AHBBUSWAIT
BitField.description: AHB Read/Write access to Serial Flash Memory space will timeout if not data received from Flash or data not transmitted after AHBBUSWAIT * 1024 ahb clock cycles, AHB Bus will get an error response

BitField.name: SEQWAIT
BitField.description: Command Sequence Execution will timeout and abort after SEQWAIT * 1024 Serial Root Clock cycles

BitField.name: CLRAHBBUFOPT
BitField.description: This bit determines whether AHB RX Buffer and AHB TX Buffer will be cleaned automatically when FlexSPI returns STOP mode ACK. Software should set this bit if AHB RX Buffer or AHB TX Buffer will be powered off in STOP mode. Otherwise AHB read access after exiting STOP mode may hit AHB RX Buffer or AHB TX Buffer but their data entries are invalid.

Enum.name: CLRAHBBUFOPT_0
Enum.description: AHB RX/TX Buffer will not be cleaned automatically when FlexSPI return Stop mode ACK.

Enum.name: CLRAHBBUFOPT_1
Enum.description: AHB RX/TX Buffer will be cleaned automatically when FlexSPI return Stop mode ACK.

BitField.name: SAMEDEVICEEN
BitField.description: All external devices are same devices (both in types and size) for A1/A2/B1/B2.

Enum.name: individual_parallel
Enum.description: In Individual mode, FLSHA1CRx/FLSHA2CRx/FLSHB1CRx/FLSHB2CRx register setting will be applied to Flash A1/A2/B1/B2 separately. In Parallel mode, FLSHA1CRx register setting will be applied to Flash A1 and B1, FLSHA2CRx register setting will be applied to Flash A2 and B2. FLSHB1CRx/FLSHB2CRx register settings will be ignored.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: FLSHA1CR0/FLSHA1CR1/FLSHA1CR2 register settings will be applied to Flash A1/A2/B1/B2. FLSHA2CRx/FLSHB1CRx/FLSHB2CRx will be ignored.

BitField.name: SCKBDIFFOPT
BitField.description: B_SCLK pad can be used as A_SCLK differential clock output (inverted clock to A_SCLK). In this case, port B flash access is not available. After changing the value of this field, MCR0[SWRESET] should be set.

Enum.name: SCKBDIFFOPT_0
Enum.description: B_SCLK pad is used as port B SCLK clock output. Port B flash access is available.

Enum.name: SCKBDIFFOPT_1
Enum.description: B_SCLK pad is used as port A SCLK inverted clock output (Differential clock to A_SCLK). Port B flash access is not available.

BitField.name: RESUMEWAIT
BitField.description: Wait cycle (in AHB clock cycle) for idle state before suspended command sequence resumed.

BitField.name: APAREN
BitField.description: Parallel mode enabled for AHB triggered Command (both read and write) .

Enum.name: individual
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Individual mode.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Parallel mode.

BitField.name: CLRAHBRXBUF
BitField.description: Clear the status/pointers of AHB RX Buffer. Auto-cleared.

BitField.name: CLRAHBTXBUF
BitField.description: Clear the status/pointers of AHB TX Buffer. Auto-cleared. For internal use only.

BitField.name: CACHABLEEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus cachable read access support.

Enum.name: CACHABLEEN_0
Enum.description: Disabled. When there is AHB bus cachable read access, FlexSPI will not check whether it hit AHB TX Buffer.

Enum.name: CACHABLEEN_1
Enum.description: Enabled. When there is AHB bus cachable read access, FlexSPI will check whether it hit AHB TX Buffer first.

BitField.name: BUFFERABLEEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus bufferable write access support. This field affects the last beat of AHB write access, refer for more details about AHB bufferable write.

Enum.name: BUFFERABLEEN_0
Enum.description: Disabled. For all AHB write access (no matter bufferable or non-bufferable ), FlexSPI will return AHB Bus ready after all data is transmitted to External device and AHB command finished.

Enum.name: BUFFERABLEEN_1
Enum.description: Enabled. For AHB bufferable write access, FlexSPI will return AHB Bus ready when the AHB command is granted by arbitrator and will not wait for AHB command finished.

BitField.name: READADDROPT
BitField.description: AHB Read Address option bit. This option bit is intend to remove AHB burst start address alignment limitation.

Enum.name: READADDROPT_0
Enum.description: There is AHB read burst start address alignment limitation when flash is accessed in parallel mode or flash is word-addressable.

Enum.name: READADDROPT_1
Enum.description: There is no AHB read burst start address alignment limitation. FlexSPI will fetch more data than AHB burst required to meet the alignment requirement.

Enum.name: READSZALIGN_0
Enum.description: AHB read size will be decided by other register setting like PREFETCH_EN

Enum.name: READSZALIGN_1
Enum.description: AHB read size to up size to 8 bytes aligned, no prefetching

BitField.name: IPCMDDONEEN
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Execution finished interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPCMDGEEN
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt enable.

BitField.name: AHBCMDGEEN
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPCMDERREN
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt enable.

BitField.name: AHBCMDERREN
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPRXWAEN
BitField.description: IP RX FIFO WaterMark available interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPTXWEEN
BitField.description: IP TX FIFO WaterMark empty interrupt enable.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYRDEN
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async RX FIFO full interrupt enable.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYWREN
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async TX FIFO empty interrupt enable.

BitField.name: AHBBUSTIMEOUTEN
BitField.description: AHB Bus timeout interrupt.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

BitField.name: SEQTIMEOUTEN
BitField.description: Sequence execution timeout interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

BitField.name: IPCMDDONE
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Execution finished interrupt. This interrupt is also generated when there is IPCMDGE or IPCMDERR interrupt generated.

BitField.name: IPCMDGE
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt.

BitField.name: AHBCMDGE
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt.

BitField.name: IPCMDERR
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt. When an error detected for IP command, this command will be ignored and not executed at all.

BitField.name: AHBCMDERR
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt. When an error detected for AHB command, this command will be ignored and not executed at all.

BitField.name: IPRXWA
BitField.description: IP RX FIFO watermark available interrupt.

BitField.name: IPTXWE
BitField.description: IP TX FIFO watermark empty interrupt.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYRD
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async RX FIFO full interrupt.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYWR
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async TX FIFO empty interrupt.

BitField.name: AHBBUSTIMEOUT
BitField.description: AHB Bus timeout interrupt.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

BitField.name: KEY
BitField.description: The Key to lock or unlock LUT.

BitField.name: BUFSZ
BitField.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

BitField.name: MSTRID
BitField.description: This AHB RX Buffer is assigned according to AHB Master with ID (MSTR_ID).

BitField.name: PRIORITY
BitField.description: This priority for AHB Master Read which this AHB RX Buffer is assigned. 7 is the highest priority, 0 the lowest.

BitField.name: REGIONEN
BitField.description: AHB RX Buffer address region funciton enable

BitField.name: PREFETCHEN
BitField.description: AHB Read Prefetch Enable for current AHB RX Buffer corresponding Master.

BitField.name: BUFSZ
BitField.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_0
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 1 serial clock cycle

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_1
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 256 serial clock cycle

BitField.name: CSINTERVAL
BitField.description: This field is used to set the minimum interval between flash device Chip selection deassertion and flash device Chip selection assertion. If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_0
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 1 serial clock cycle

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_1
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 256 serial clock cycle

BitField.name: CSINTERVAL

If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_0

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_1

If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

BitField.name: ARDSEQID

BitField.name: ARDSEQNUM

BitField.name: AWRSEQNUM

BitField.name: AWRWAIT
BitField.description: For certain devices (such as FPGA), it need some time to write data into internal memory after the command sequences finished on FlexSPI interface

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_0
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_1
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_2
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_3
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 128 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_4
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 512 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_5
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2048 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_6
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8192 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_7
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32768 ahb clock cycle

BitField.description: Clear the instruction pointer which is internally saved pointer by JMP_ON_CS. Refer Programmable Sequence Engine for details.

BitField.description: For certain devices (such as FPGA), it need some time to write data into internal memory after the command sequences finished on FlexSPI interface

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_0
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_1
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_2
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_3
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 128 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_4
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 512 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_5
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2048 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_6
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8192 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_7
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32768 ahb clock cycle

BitField.name: CLRINSTRPTR
BitField.description: Clear the instruction pointer which is internally saved pointer by JMP_ON_CS. Refer Programmable Sequence Engine for details.

BitField.name: WMOPT1
BitField.description: Write mask option bit 1. This option bit could be used to remove AHB write burst start address alignment limitation.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: DQS pin will be used as Write Mask when writing to external device. There is no limitation on AHB write burst start address alignment when flash is accessed in individual mode.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: DQS pin will not be used as Write Mask when writing to external device. There is limitation on AHB write burst start address alignment when flash is accessed in individual mode.

BitField.name: WMENA
BitField.description: Write mask enable bit for flash device on port A. When write mask function is needed for memory device on port A, this bit must be set.

Enum.name: WMENA_0
Enum.description: Write mask is disabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be un-driven when writing to external device.

Enum.name: WMENA_1
Enum.description: Write mask is enabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be driven by FlexSPI as write mask output when writing to external device.

BitField.name: WMENB
BitField.description: Write mask enable bit for flash device on port B. When write mask function is needed for memory device on port B, this bit must be set.

Enum.name: WMENB_0
Enum.description: Write mask is disabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be un-driven when writing to external device.

Enum.name: WMENB_1
Enum.description: Write mask is enabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be driven by FlexSPI as write mask output when writing to external device.

BitField.name: SFAR
BitField.description: Serial Flash Address for IP command.

BitField.name: IDATSZ
BitField.description: Flash Read/Program Data Size (in Bytes) for IP command.

BitField.name: ISEQID
BitField.description: Sequence Index in LUT for IP command.

BitField.name: ISEQNUM
BitField.description: Sequence Number for IP command: ISEQNUM+1.

BitField.name: IPAREN
BitField.description: Parallel mode Enabled for IP command.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Individual mode.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Parallel mode.

BitField.name: TRG
BitField.description: Setting this bit will trigger an IP Command.

BitField.name: CLRIPRXF
BitField.description: Clear all valid data entries in IP RX FIFO.

BitField.name: RXDMAEN
BitField.description: IP RX FIFO reading by DMA enabled.

Enum.name: RXDMAEN_0
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO would be read by processor.

Enum.name: RXDMAEN_1
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO would be read by DMA.

BitField.name: CLRIPTXF
BitField.description: Clear all valid data entries in IP TX FIFO.

BitField.name: TXDMAEN
BitField.description: IP TX FIFO filling by DMA enabled.

Enum.name: TXDMAEN_0
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO would be filled by processor.

Enum.name: TXDMAEN_1
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO would be filled by DMA.

BitField.name: DLLRESET
BitField.description: Software could force a reset on DLL by setting this field to 0x1. This will cause the DLL to lose lock and re-calibrate to detect an ref_clock half period phase shift. The reset action is edge triggered, so software need to clear this bit after set this bit (no delay limitation).

BitField.name: SLVDLYTARGET
BitField.description: The delay target for slave delay line is: ((SLVDLYTARGET+1) * 1/32 * clock cycle of reference clock (serial root clock). If serial root clock is >= 100 MHz, DLLEN set to 0x1, OVRDEN set to =0x0, then SLVDLYTARGET setting of 0xF is recommended.

BitField.name: OVRDEN
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override enable.

BitField.name: OVRDVAL
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override value.

BitField.name: DLLRESET
BitField.description: Software could force a reset on DLL by setting this field to 0x1. This will cause the DLL to lose lock and re-calibrate to detect an ref_clock half period phase shift. The reset action is edge triggered, so software need to clear this bit after set this bit (no delay limitation).

BitField.name: SLVDLYTARGET
BitField.description: The delay target for slave delay line is: ((SLVDLYTARGET+1) * 1/32 * clock cycle of reference clock (serial root clock). If serial root clock is >= 100 MHz, DLLEN set to 0x1, OVRDEN set to =0x0, then SLVDLYTARGET setting of 0xF is recommended.

BitField.name: OVRDEN
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override enable.

BitField.name: OVRDVAL
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override value.

BitField.name: SEQIDLE
BitField.description: This status bit indicates the state machine in SEQ_CTL is idle and there is command sequence executing on FlexSPI interface.

BitField.name: ARBIDLE
BitField.description: This status bit indicates the state machine in ARB_CTL is busy and there is command sequence granted by arbitrator and not finished yet on FlexSPI interface. When ARB_CTL state (ARBIDLE=0x1) is idle, there will be no transaction on FlexSPI interface also (SEQIDLE=0x1). So this bit should be polled to wait for FlexSPI controller become idle instead of SEQIDLE.

BitField.name: ARBCMDSRC
BitField.description: This status field indicates the trigger source of current command sequence granted by arbitrator. This field value is meaningless when ARB_CTL is not busy (STS0[ARBIDLE]=0x1).

Enum.name: ARBCMDSRC_0
Enum.description: Triggered by AHB read command (triggered by AHB read).

Enum.name: ARBCMDSRC_1
Enum.description: Triggered by AHB write command (triggered by AHB Write).

Enum.name: ARBCMDSRC_2
Enum.description: Triggered by IP command (triggered by setting register bit IPCMD.TRG).

BitField.name: AHBCMDERRID
BitField.description: Indicates the sequence index when an AHB command error is detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[AHBCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

BitField.name: AHBCMDERRCODE
BitField.description: Indicates the Error Code when AHB command Error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[AHBCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_2
Enum.description: AHB Write command with JMP_ON_CS instruction used in the sequence.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_3
Enum.description: There is unknown instruction opcode in the sequence.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_4
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_RWDS_SDR used in DDR sequence.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_5
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_DDR/DUMMY_RWDS_DDR used in SDR sequence.

BitField.name: IPCMDERRID
BitField.description: Indicates the sequence Index when IP command error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[IPCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

BitField.name: IPCMDERRCODE
BitField.description: Indicates the Error Code when IP command Error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[IPCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_2
Enum.description: IP command with JMP_ON_CS instruction used in the sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_3
Enum.description: There is unknown instruction opcode in the sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_4
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_RWDS_SDR used in DDR sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_5
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_DDR/DUMMY_RWDS_DDR used in SDR sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_6
Enum.description: Flash access start address exceed the whole flash address range (A1/A2/B1/B2).

BitField.name: ASLVLOCK
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock slave delay line locked.

BitField.name: AREFLOCK
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock reference delay line locked.

BitField.name: ASLVSEL
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock slave delay line delay cell number selection .

BitField.name: AREFSEL
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock reference delay line delay cell number selection.

BitField.name: BSLVLOCK
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock slave delay line locked.

BitField.name: BREFLOCK
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock reference delay line locked.

BitField.name: BSLVSEL
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock slave delay line delay cell number selection.

BitField.name: BREFSEL
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock reference delay line delay cell number selection.

BitField.name: ACTIVE
BitField.description: Indicates if an AHB read prefetch command sequence has been suspended.

BitField.name: BUFID
BitField.description: AHB RX BUF ID for suspended command sequence.

BitField.name: DATLFT
BitField.description: Left Data size for suspended command sequence (in byte).

BitField.name: FILL
BitField.description: Fill level of IP RX FIFO.

BitField.name: RDCNTR
BitField.description: Total Read Data Counter: RDCNTR * 64 Bits.

BitField.name: FILL
BitField.description: Fill level of IP TX FIFO.

BitField.name: WRCNTR
BitField.description: Total Write Data Counter: WRCNTR * 64 Bits.

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Revision number of the controller core.

BitField.name: PHYW
BitField.description: Data width of the transciever connected to the controller core. PHYW bit reset value is

Enum.name: PHYW_0
Enum.description: 8 bit wide data bus Software non-programmable

Enum.name: PHYW_1
Enum.description: 16 bit wide data bus Software non-programmable

Enum.name: PHYW_2
Enum.description: Reset to 8 bit wide data bus Software programmable

Enum.name: PHYW_3
Enum.description: Reset to 16 bit wide data bus Software programmable

Enum.name: PHYM_5
Enum.description: Software programmable - reset to ULPI DDR

Enum.name: SM_0
Enum.description: No Serial Engine, always use parallel signalling.

Enum.name: SM_1
Enum.description: Serial Engine present, always use serial signalling for FS/LS.

Enum.name: SM_2
Enum.description: Software programmable - Reset to use parallel signalling for FS/LS

Enum.name: SM_3
Enum.description: Software programmable - Reset to use serial signalling for FS/LS

BitField.name: HC
BitField.description: Host Capable. Indicating whether host operation mode is supported or not.

BitField.name: NPORT
BitField.description: The Nmber of downstream ports supported by the host controller is (NPORT+1)

BitField.name: DC
BitField.description: Device Capable. Indicating whether device operation mode is supported or not.

BitField.name: TXBURST
BitField.description: Default burst size for memory to TX buffer transfer

BitField.name: TXCHANADD
BitField.description: TX FIFO Buffer size is: (2^TXCHANADD) * 4 Bytes

BitField.name: RXBURST
BitField.description: Default burst size for memory to RX buffer transfer

BitField.name: RXADD
BitField.description: Buffer total size for all receive endpoints is (2^RXADD)

BitField.name: GPTLD
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Load Value These bit fields are loaded to GPTCNT bits when GPTRST bit is set '1b'

BitField.name: GPTCNT
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Counter. This field is the count value of the countdown timer.

BitField.name: GPTMODE
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Mode In one shot mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt, and stop until the counter is reset by software; In repeat mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt and automatically reload the counter value from GPTLD bits to start again

Enum.name: GPTRST_1
Enum.description: Load counter value from GPTLD bits in n_GPTIMER0LD

BitField.name: GPTRUN
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Run GPTCNT bits are not effected when setting or clearing this bit.

BitField.name: GPTLD
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Load Value These bit fields are loaded to GPTCNT bits when GPTRST bit is set '1b'

BitField.name: GPTCNT
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Counter. This field is the count value of the countdown timer.

BitField.name: GPTMODE
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Mode In one shot mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt, and stop until the counter is reset by software

Enum.name: GPTRST_1
Enum.description: Load counter value from GPTLD bits in USB_n_GPTIMER0LD

BitField.name: GPTRUN
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Run GPTCNT bits are not effected when setting or clearing this bit.

BitField.name: AHBBRST
BitField.description: AHB master interface Burst configuration These bits control AHB master transfer type sequence (or priority)

Enum.name: AHBBRST_0
Enum.description: Incremental burst of unspecified length only

Enum.name: AHBBRST_2
Enum.description: INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then single transfer

Enum.name: AHBBRST_3
Enum.description: INCR16 burst, INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then single transfer

Enum.name: AHBBRST_5
Enum.description: INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

Enum.name: AHBBRST_6
Enum.description: INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

Enum.name: AHBBRST_7
Enum.description: INCR16 burst, INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

BitField.name: CAPLENGTH
BitField.description: These bits are used as an offset to add to register base to find the beginning of the Operational Register

BitField.name: HCIVERSION
BitField.description: Host Controller Interface Version Number Default value is '10h', which means EHCI rev1.0.

BitField.name: PPC
BitField.description: Port Power Control This field indicates whether the host controller implementation includes port power control

BitField.name: N_PCC
BitField.description: Number of Ports per Companion Controller This field indicates the number of ports supported per internal Companion Controller

Enum.name: N_CC_0
Enum.description: There is no internal Companion Controller and port-ownership hand-off is not supported.

Enum.name: N_CC_1
Enum.description: There are internal companion controller(s) and port-ownership hand-offs is supported.

BitField.name: PI
BitField.description: Port Indicators (P INDICATOR) This bit indicates whether the ports support port indicator control

BitField.name: N_PTT
BitField.description: Number of Ports per Transaction Translator (N_PTT)

BitField.name: ADC
BitField.description: 64-bit Addressing Capability This bit is set '0b' in all controller core, no 64-bit addressing capability is supported

BitField.name: PFL
BitField.description: Programmable Frame List Flag If this bit is set to zero, then the system software must use a frame list length of 1024 elements with this host controller

BitField.name: ASP
BitField.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Capability If this bit is set to a one, then the host controller supports the park feature for high-speed queue heads in the Asynchronous Schedule

BitField.name: DCIVERSION
BitField.description: Device Controller Interface Version Number Default value is '01h', which means rev0.1.

BitField.name: DEN
BitField.description: Device Endpoint Number This field indicates the number of endpoints built into the device controller

BitField.name: DC
BitField.description: Device Capable When this bit is 1, this controller is capable of operating as a USB 2.0 device.

BitField.name: HC
BitField.description: Host Capable When this bit is 1, this controller is capable of operating as an EHCI compatible USB 2

Enum.name: PSE_0
Enum.description: Do not process the Periodic Schedule

Enum.name: PSE_1
Enum.description: Use the PERIODICLISTBASE register to access the Periodic Schedule.

Enum.name: ASE_0
Enum.description: Do not process the Asynchronous Schedule.

Enum.name: ASE_1
Enum.description: Use the ASYNCLISTADDR register to access the Asynchronous Schedule.

BitField.name: IAA
BitField.description: Interrupt on Async Advance Doorbell - Read/Write

BitField.name: ASP
BitField.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Mode Count - Read/Write

BitField.name: ASPE
BitField.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Mode Enable - Read/Write

BitField.name: FS_2
BitField.description: Frame List Size - (Read/Write or Read Only)

BitField.name: UE
BitField.description: USB Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: UEE
BitField.description: USB Error Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UEI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: PCE
BitField.description: Port Change Detect Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the PCI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: FRE
BitField.description: Frame List Rollover Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the FRI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: SEE
BitField.description: System Error Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SEI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: AAE
BitField.description: Async Advance Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the AAI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: URE
BitField.description: USB Reset Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the URI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: SRE
BitField.description: SOF Received Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SRI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: SLE
BitField.description: Sleep Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SLI bit in n_n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: ULPIE
BitField.description: ULPI Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UPLII bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: NAKE
BitField.description: NAK Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the NAKI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: UAIE
BitField.description: USB Host Asynchronous Interrupt Enable When this bit is one, and the UAI bit in the n_USBSTS register is one, host controller will issue an interrupt at the next interrupt threshold

BitField.name: UPIE
BitField.description: USB Host Periodic Interrupt Enable When this bit is one, and the UPI bit in the n_USBSTS register is one, host controller will issue an interrupt at the next interrupt threshold

BitField.name: TIE0
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer #0 Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the TI0 bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: TIE1
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer #1 Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the TI1 bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: USBADR
BitField.description: Device Address. These bits correspond to the USB device address

BitField.name: CF
BitField.description: Configure Flag Host software sets this bit as the last action in its process of configuring the Host Controller

Enum.name: CF_0
Enum.description: Port routing control logic default-routes each port to an implementation dependent classic host controller.

Enum.name: CF_1
Enum.description: Port routing control logic default-routes all ports to this host controller.

Enum.name: OCA_0
Enum.description: This port does not have an over-current condition.

Enum.name: OCA_1
Enum.description: This port currently has an over-current condition

BitField.name: PR
BitField.description: Port Reset - Read/Write or Read Only

BitField.name: PHCD
BitField.description: PHY Low Power Suspend - Clock Disable (PLPSCD) - Read/Write

BitField.name: PFSC
BitField.description: Port Force Full Speed Connect - Read/Write

BitField.name: PSPD
BitField.description: Port Speed - Read Only. This register field indicates the speed at which the port is operating.

BitField.name: PTW
BitField.description: Parallel Transceiver Width This bit has no effect if serial interface engine is used

BitField.name: STS
BitField.description: Serial Transceiver Select 1 Serial Interface Engine is selected 0 Parallel Interface signals is selected Serial Interface Engine can be used in combination with UTMI+/ULPI physical interface to provide FS/LS signaling instead of the parallel interface signals

BitField.name: PTS_1
BitField.description: All USB port interface modes are listed in this field description, but not all are supported

BitField.name: VD
BitField.description: VBUS_Discharge - Read/Write. Setting this bit causes VBus to discharge through a resistor.

BitField.name: IDPU
BitField.description: ID Pullup - Read/Write This bit provide control over the ID pull-up resistor; 0 = off, 1 = on [default]

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: USB ID - Read Only. 0 = A device, 1 = B device

BitField.name: AVV
BitField.description: A VBus Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the A VBus valid threshold.

BitField.name: ASV
BitField.description: A Session Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the A session valid threshold.

BitField.name: BSV
BitField.description: B Session Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the B session valid threshold.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: B Session End - Read Only. Indicates VBus is below the B session end threshold.

BitField.name: TOG_1MS
BitField.description: 1 millisecond timer toggle - Read Only. This bit toggles once per millisecond.

BitField.name: DPS
BitField.description: Data Bus Pulsing Status - Read Only

BitField.name: AVVIS
BitField.description: A VBus Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: ASVIS
BitField.description: A Session Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: BSVIS
BitField.description: B Session Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: BSEIS
BitField.description: B Session End Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: STATUS_1MS
BitField.description: 1 millisecond timer Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: DPIS
BitField.description: Data Pulse Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: IDIE
BitField.description: USB ID Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the USB ID interrupt.

BitField.name: AVVIE
BitField.description: A VBus Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the A VBus valid interrupt.

BitField.name: ASVIE
BitField.description: A Session Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write

BitField.name: BSVIE
BitField.description: B Session Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write

BitField.name: BSEIE
BitField.description: B Session End Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the B session end interrupt.

Enum.name: CM_2
Enum.description: Device Controller [Default for device only controller]

Enum.name: CM_3
Enum.description: Host Controller [Default for host only controller]

Enum.name: SLOM_1
Enum.description: Setup Lockouts Off (DCD requires use of Setup Data Buffer Tripwire in USBCMDUSB Command Register .

BitField.name: ERBR
BitField.description: Endpoint Receive Buffer Ready -- Read Only

BitField.name: ETBR
BitField.description: Endpoint Transmit Buffer Ready -- Read Only

BitField.name: RXS
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK

BitField.name: RXT
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control Endpoint0 is fixed as a Control End Point.

BitField.name: RXE
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Enable 1 Enabled Endpoint0 is always enabled.

BitField.name: TXS
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK [Default] 1 End Point Stalled Software can write a one to this bit to force the endpoint to return a STALL handshake to the Host

BitField.name: TXT
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 - Control Endpoint0 is fixed as a Control End Point.

BitField.name: TXE
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Enable 1 Enabled Endpoint0 is always enabled.

BitField.name: RXS
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK

BitField.name: RXD
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Data Sink - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [Default] Should always be written as zero

BitField.name: RXT
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

BitField.name: RXI
BitField.description: RX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled This bit is only used for test and should always be written as zero

BitField.name: RXR
BitField.description: RX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the host and device

BitField.name: RXE
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Enable 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled An Endpoint should be enabled only after it has been configured

BitField.name: TXS
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK 1 End Point Stalled This bit will be cleared automatically upon receipt of a SETUP request if this Endpoint is configured as a Control Endpoint and this bit will continue to be cleared by hardware until the associated ENDPTSETUPSTAT bit is cleared

BitField.name: TXD
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Data Source - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [DEFAULT] Should always be written as 0

BitField.name: TXT
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

BitField.name: TXI
BitField.description: TX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 PID Sequencing Enabled

BitField.name: TXR
BitField.description: TX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the Host and device

BitField.name: OVER_CUR_POL
BitField.description: OTG1 Polarity of Overcurrent The polarity of OTG1 port overcurrent event

Enum.name: OVER_CUR_POL_0
Enum.description: High active (high on this signal represents an overcurrent condition)

Enum.name: OVER_CUR_POL_1
Enum.description: Low active (low on this signal represents an overcurrent condition)

BitField.name: PWR_POL
BitField.description: OTG1 Power Polarity This bit should be set according to PMIC Power Pin polarity.

Enum.name: PWR_POL_0
Enum.description: PMIC Power Pin is Low active.

Enum.name: PWR_POL_1
Enum.description: PMIC Power Pin is High active.

BitField.name: WIE
BitField.description: OTG1 Wake-up Interrupt Enable This bit enables or disables the OTG1 wake-up interrupt

BitField.name: WKUP_ID_EN
BitField.description: OTG1 Wake-up on ID change enable

BitField.name: WKUP_VBUS_EN
BitField.description: OTG1 wake-up on VBUS change enable

Enum.name: WKUP_DPDM_EN_0
Enum.description: DPDM changes wake-up to be disabled only when VBUS is 0.

Enum.name: WKUP_DPDM_EN_1
Enum.description: (Default) DPDM changes wake-up to be enabled, it is for device only.

BitField.name: WIR
BitField.description: OTG1 Wake-up Interrupt Request This bit indicates that a wake-up interrupt request is received on the OTG1 port

BitField.name: UTMI_CLK_VLD
BitField.description: Indicating whether OTG1 UTMI PHY clock is valid

BitField.name: ENABLE_CONTEXT_SWITCHING
BitField.description: Enable automatic context switching for the channels

BitField.name: ENABLE_CONTEXT_CACHING
BitField.description: The software must set this bit to enable the caching of contexts between the operations

BitField.name: GATHER_RESIDUAL_WRITES
BitField.description: The software must set this bit to enable the ragged writes to the unaligned buffers to be gathered between multiple write operations

BitField.name: PRESENT_SHA
BitField.description: Indicates whether the SHA1/SHA2 functions are present.

BitField.name: PRESENT_CRYPTO
BitField.description: Indicates whether the crypto (cipher/hash) functions are present.

BitField.name: CLKGATE
BitField.description: This bit must be set to zero for a normal operation

BitField.name: SFTRST
BitField.description: Set this bit to zero to enable a normal DCP operation

BitField.name: IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates which channels have pending interrupt requests

BitField.name: READY_CHANNELS
BitField.description: Indicates which channels are ready to proceed with a transfer (the active channel is also included)

BitField.name: OTP_KEY_READY
BitField.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

BitField.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

BitField.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

BitField.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

BitField.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
BitField.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

BitField.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

BitField.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

BitField.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
BitField.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

BitField.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

BitField.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

BitField.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED

BitField.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

BitField.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

BitField.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
BitField.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

BitField.name: NUM_KEYS
BitField.description: Encoded value indicating the number of key-storage locations implemented in the design

BitField.name: NUM_CHANNELS
BitField.description: Encoded value indicating the number of channels implemented in the design

BitField.name: DISABLE_UNIQUE_KEY
BitField.description: Write to a 1 to disable the per-device unique key

BitField.name: DISABLE_DECRYPT
BitField.description: Write to 1 to disable the decryption

BitField.name: CIPHER_ALGORITHMS
BitField.description: One-hot field indicating which cipher algorithms are available

BitField.name: HASH_ALGORITHMS
BitField.description: One-hot field indicating which hashing features are implemented in the hardware

BitField.name: INDEX
BitField.description: Key index pointer. The valid indices are 0-[number_keys].

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Word 0 data for the key. This is the least-significant word.

BitField.name: INTERRUPT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the channel must issue an interrupt upon the completion of the packet.

BitField.name: DECR_SEMAPHORE
BitField.description: Reflects whether the channel's semaphore must be decremented at the end of the current operation

BitField.name: CHAIN
BitField.description: Reflects whether the next command pointer register must be loaded into the channel's current descriptor pointer

BitField.name: CHAIN_CONTIGUOUS
BitField.description: Reflects whether the next packet's address is located following this packet's payload.

BitField.name: ENABLE_MEMCOPY
BitField.description: Reflects whether the selected memory-copy (memcopy) function should be enabled for this operation.

BitField.name: ENABLE_CIPHER
BitField.description: Reflects whether the selected cipher function must be enabled for this operation.

BitField.name: ENABLE_HASH
BitField.description: Reflects whether the selected hashing function must be enabled for this operation.

BitField.name: ENABLE_BLIT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP must perform a blit operation

BitField.name: CIPHER_ENCRYPT
BitField.description: When the cipher block is enabled, this bit indicates whether the operation is encryption or decryption

BitField.name: CIPHER_INIT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the cipher block must load the initialization vector from the payload for this operation

BitField.name: OTP_KEY
BitField.description: Reflects whether a hardware-based key must be used

BitField.name: PAYLOAD_KEY
BitField.description: When set, it indicates the payload contains the key

BitField.name: HASH_INIT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the initial block in the hashing operation, so the hash registers must be initialized before the operation

BitField.name: HASH_TERM
BitField.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the final block in the hashing operation, so the hash padding must be applied by the hardware

BitField.name: CHECK_HASH
BitField.description: Reflects whether the calculated hash value must be compared to the hash provided in the payload.

BitField.name: HASH_OUTPUT
BitField.description: When the hashing is enabled, this bit controls whether the input or output data is hashed.

BitField.name: CONSTANT_FILL
BitField.description: When this bit is set (MEMCOPY and BLIT modes only), the DCP simply fills the destination buffer with the value found in the source address field

BitField.name: TEST_SEMA_IRQ
BitField.description: This bit is used to test the channel semaphore transition to 0. FOR TEST USE ONLY!

BitField.name: KEY_BYTESWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key bytes (big-endian key).

BitField.name: KEY_WORDSWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key words (big-endian key).

BitField.name: INPUT_BYTESWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the input data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: INPUT_WORDSWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the input data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: OUTPUT_BYTESWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the output data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: OUTPUT_WORDSWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the output data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: CIPHER_MODE
BitField.description: Cipher mode selection field. Reflects the mode of operation for the cipher operations.

BitField.name: CIPHER_CFG
BitField.description: Cipher configuration bits. Optional configuration bits are required for the ciphers.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Byte count register. This value is the working value and updates as the operation proceeds.

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: This regiser reflects the payload pointer for the current control packet.

Register.name: DCP_CH0CMDPTR
Register.description: DCP channel 0 command pointer address register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Pointer to the descriptor structure to be processed for channel 0.

BitField.name: INCREMENT
BitField.description: The value written to this field is added to the semaphore count in an atomic way such that the simultaneous software adds and DCP hardware substracts happening on the same clock are protected

BitField.name: VALUE
BitField.description: This read-only field shows the current (instantaneous) value of the semaphore counter.

BitField.name: HASH_MISMATCH
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

BitField.name: ERROR_SETUP
BitField.description: This bit indicates that the hardware detected an invalid programming configuration (such as a buffer length that is not a multiple of the natural data size for the operation)

BitField.name: ERROR_PACKET
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading the packet or payload, or when writing the status back to the packet payload

BitField.name: ERROR_SRC
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading from the source buffer

BitField.name: ERROR_DST
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when storing to the destination buffer

BitField.name: ERROR_PAGEFAULT
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a page fault occurred while converting a virtual address to a physical address

BitField.name: ERROR_CODE
BitField.description: Indicates the additional error codes for some of the error conditions

Enum.name: NEXT_CHAIN_IS_0
Enum.description: Error signalled because the next pointer is 0x00000000

Enum.name: NO_CHAIN
Enum.description: Error signalled because the semaphore is non-zero and neither chain bit is set

Enum.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
Enum.description: Error signalled because an error is reported reading/writing the context buffer

Enum.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
Enum.description: Error signalled because an error is reported reading/writing the payload

Enum.name: INVALID_MODE
Enum.description: Error signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for instance, blit + hash)

BitField.name: TAG
BitField.description: Indicates the tag from the last completed packet in the command structure

BitField.name: HASH_MISMATCH
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

BitField.name: ERROR_SETUP
BitField.description: This bit indicates that the hardware detected an invalid programming configuration (such as a buffer length that is not a multiple of the natural data size for the operation)

Register.name: DCP_CH1CMDPTR
Register.description: DCP channel 1 command pointer address register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Pointer to the descriptor structure to be processed for channel 1.

BitField.name: INCREMENT
BitField.description: The value written to this field is added to the semaphore count in an atomic way, such that the simultaneous software adds and the DCP hardware substracts happening on the same clock are protected

BitField.name: VALUE
BitField.description: This read-only field shows the current (instantaneous) value of the semaphore counter.

BitField.name: HASH_MISMATCH
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation is mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

BitField.name: ERROR_SRC

BitField.name: ERROR_DST
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when storing to the destination buffer

BitField.name: ERROR_PAGEFAULT
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a page fault occurred while converting a virtual address to a physical address

BitField.name: ERROR_CODE
BitField.description: Indicates the additional error codes for some of the error conditions.

Enum.description: Error is signalled because the semaphore is of a non-zero value and neither of the chain bits is set.

Enum.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
Enum.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported when reading/writing the context buffer.

Enum.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
Enum.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported when reading/writing the payload.

Enum.name: INVALID_MODE
Enum.description: Error is signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for example, blit + hash).
